patterns: How can I find you on LinkedIn?
responses: You can find me on LinkedIn at linkedin.com/in/akshay-jambekar-772244188.

I am a Data Scientist with a robust experience of 3+ years as an Oracle Database Administrator, transitioning into data science with hands-on expertise in machine learning, deep learning, and data analysis. I am proficient in developing predictive models, data visualization, and deploying deep learning solutions to drive business impact. I am eager to leverage my technical skills and analytical mindset to solve complex data problems and contribute to innovative solutions.

My skills include: 
- Programming Languages: Python, Java, HTML
- Databases: Oracle, SQL
- Operating Systems: Windows, Linux
- Machine Learning: Predictive models, hyperparameter tuning, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-Learn
- Deep Learning: Artificial Neural Networks (ANN), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN)
- Natural Language Processing (NLP): NLTK
- Generative AI: Hugging Face
- Data Analysis and Visualization: Tableau, Power BI, Pandas, Matplotlib
- Cloud Technologies: Microsoft Azure, AWS
- Version Control: Git, GitHub, Bitbucket
- Soft Skills: Critical Thinking, Communication, Teamwork

patterns: Tell me about your work experience
responses:
I have worked as an Oracle DBA at Capgemini in Pune, Maharashtra from June 2021 to Present. My responsibilities included conducting Oracle/Exadata patching, maintaining database security, improving query performance, and initiating machine learning models to automate routine database maintenance tasks. 

I also worked as a Python Developer Intern at Leometric Technology in Pune, Maharashtra from January 2021 to May 2021. My responsibilities included developing backend APIs using Django and implementing machine learning models for data-driven decision-making in project workflows.

patterns: Tell me about your project on apple diseases
What is the apple disease classification project?
Describe your project on classifying apple diseases
What did you do in the apple diseases project?
responses: I developed a deep learning model to classify apple diseases, leveraging convolutional neural networks (CNN) to analyze images and predict disease types. The key techniques involved employing CNN for image analysis and disease type prediction. I achieved an accuracy rate of 87% in classifying apple diseases. This project was registered with a copyright (ROC No: L-93370/2020). The tools used were Python, TensorFlow, and Keras.

patterns: Tell me about your flood detection project
What is the flood detection project?
Describe your project on flood detection
What did you do in the flood detection project?
responses: I participated in a Kaggle competition to predict flood probabilities and aid in early disaster management using HistGradientBoostingRegressor. The key techniques involved utilizing Gradient Boosting techniques for regression analysis. I achieved an RÂ² score of 0.869. The tools used were Python, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, and Matplotlib. You can find this project on github: https://github.com/akshayjambekar/Flood-Detection

patterns: Tell me about your Yelp reviews project
What is the Yelp reviews classification project?
Describe your project on Yelp reviews
What did you do in the Yelp reviews project?
responses: I utilized Natural Language Processing (NLP) strategies to analyze Yelp reviews data, focusing on the classification of business ratings based on textual reviews. The key techniques involved implementing various NLP techniques for text preprocessing and feature extraction. I achieved an accuracy of 82% in classifying reviews. The model demonstrated high precision (1.00) but low recall (0.01) for 1-star reviews and strong performance (precision: 0.82, recall: 1.00) for 5-star reviews. The tools used were Python, Scikit-learn, NLTK, and other relevant NLP libraries. You can find this project on github: https://github.com/akshayjambekar/Yelp-Reviews-Classification-using-NLP

patterns: Tell me about your academic risk prediction project
What is the project on predicting academic risk?
Describe your project on academic risk prediction
What did you do in the academic risk prediction project?
responses: I developed a model to predict the academic risk of students in higher education, focusing on classifying students into categories: Graduate, Enrolled, and Dropout. The key techniques involved using HistGradientBoostingClassifier for classification and SMOTE for data augmentation to handle imbalanced data. I achieved an accuracy of 86.2% in predicting student academic risk. The model demonstrated high precision and recall across multiple categories, with a macro average f1-score of 0.86. The tools used were Python, Scikit-learn, and SMOTE. You can find this project on github: https://github.com/akshayjambekar/Predicting-Academic-Risk-of-Students-in-Higher-Education

patterns: Tell me about your traffic sign classification project
What is the traffic sign classification project?
Describe your project on traffic sign classification
What did you do in the traffic sign classification project?
responses: I implemented the LeNet deep neural network architecture for the classification of traffic sign images, crucial for self-driving car applications. The key techniques involved utilizing convolutional neural networks (CNN), specifically the LeNet architecture, to classify traffic sign images across 43 different classes. I achieved an overall accuracy of 90% in classifying traffic signs. The evaluation metrics included a micro average accuracy, precision, recall, and f1-score all at 0.90, macro average precision and recall at 0.85 and 0.83 respectively, with an f1-score of 0.83, and weighted average precision, recall, and f1-score all at 0.90. The tools used were Python, TensorFlow, Keras, and CNN. You can find this project on github: https://github.com/akshayjambekar/Traffic-Sign-Classification-using-LeNet

patterns: Where did you get your degree?
responses: I have a Bachelor of Engineering degree from Savitribai Phule Pune University in Pune, Maharashtra. I graduated in May 2020 with distinction, achieving a 77.12% score.

responses: During my Bachelor of Engineering degree, I worked on a project titled 'Classification of Apple Diseases Using Deep Learning'. In this project, I developed a deep learning model to classify apple diseases, leveraging convolutional neural networks (CNN) to analyze images and predict disease types.
